publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4223 Margaret Curran: St Bridget’s Primary, Horgan Cham pions—That the Parliament congratulates St Bridget’s Primary School of Baillieston in Glasgow for winning the Horgan Trophy; endorses the commitment of the young pupils to fitness and sport, reflected in their achievement in coming first in the football league of schools from the east end of Glasgow and winning the trophy, and encourages more young children and schools to participate in competitive sports leagues and improve the level of sports literacy across the east end.

S3M-4223 St Bridget’s Primary, Horgan Champions (lodged on 26 May 2009) Anne McLaughlin*, David Stewart*, Des McNulty*, Mary Mulligan*, James Kelly*, Karen Whitefield*, Bill Kidd*, Gil Paterson*, Jamie McGrigor*, John Park*, Stewart Maxwell*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Bob Doris*, Trish Godman*
S3M-4223 St Bridget’s Primary, Horgan Champions (lodged on 26 May 2009) Ken Macintosh*, Jackie Baillie*, Hugh Henry*, Sandra White*, Aileen Campbell*

S3M-4223 Margaret Curran: St Bridget’s Primary, Horgan Champions—That the Parliament congratulates St Bridget’s Primary School of Baillieston in Glasgow for winning the Horgan Trophy; endorses the commitment of the young pupils to fitness and sport, reflected in their achievement in coming first in the football league of schools from the east end of Glasgow and winning the trophy, and encourages more young children and schools to participate in competitive sports leagues and improve the level of sports literacy across the east end. Supported by: Anne McLaughlin, David Stewart, Des McNulty, Mary Mulligan, James Kelly, Karen Whitefield, Bill Kidd, Gil Paterson, Jamie McGrigor, John Park, Stewart Maxwell, Pauline McNeill, Mr Frank McAveety, Bob Doris, Trish Godman, Ken Macintosh, Jackie Baillie, Hugh Henry, Sandra White, Aileen Campbell
S3M-4223 St Bridget’s Primary, Horgan Champions (lodged on 26 May 2009) Sarah Boyack*, Stuart McMillan*
